title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 24 March 2017 - BBC News
summary: plans for 170 newport homes rejected by planning inspector .
tributes paid to hedgehog charity founder .

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : spanish cat turns up in midlands
text: on midlands today this lunchtime , we 'll have the unusual story of how a cat which turned up in our region has apparently made the journey from spain .
vets found the animal , nicknamed slinky , had been reported missing a month ago in mainland europe .
we 'll find out how it 's though it happened and what the next step is , on bbc one from 13:30 .
author: Joanne Malin
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: breakingwoman arrested after man stabbed in dawley
text: a 48-year-old man from telford is in hospital with serious stab wounds and a 30-year-old woman has been arrested on sus of attempted murder after an incident at a flat in dawley this morning .
police were called to terrace lodge on king street at 01:30 and are searching the property for forensic evidence .
they say they believe the victim and the suspect were known to each other .

documents.title: castle steps in to help with parking problems
text: whittington castle has offered parents free parking , to ease congestion around whittington school .
the police say people living nearby have been finding drives and footpaths blocked by vehicles at drop-off and times .

documents.title: two men killed in a525 crash named
text: police have released the names of two men killed on the a525 in north shropshire last tuesday .
they were 67-year-old walter dobrowolski from ellerdine , who had been riding a motorcycle and 79-year-old roy bundy from chester , who had been on foot .
an inquest into their deaths will open tomorrow .

documents.title: football : big week for telford 's survival chances
text: afc telford united 's fourth league defeat in succession has left them in relegation trouble , with just three points separating them from the national north drop zone .
but their next two games are against teams below them in the table , stalybridge celtic and worcester city , and telford manager rob smith said this was their `` biggest week for many a year '' .
two victories could just about guarantee their survival and smith said he wanted to `` get us safe and start again '' .
we 've just got a mini-little season now and we 've probably got the biggest week we 've had for many a year ahead of us . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: severn hos looks for gardening volunteers
text: severn hos is looking for volunteers to help look after its gardens this summer .
both the shrewsbury and telford sites have won royal horticultural society awards for their greenery .
the hos says the volunteers do n't need a high level of expertise , just the willingness to give up their time and be happy to brave the british weather throughout the year .

documents.title: two held over bank and shop armed raids
text: two held over bank and shop armed raids

documents.title: lordan nominated for blue plaque for apache
text: the singer , musician and writer jerry lordan has been nominated to receive a blue plaque on a building in bishop 's castle as part of a bbc music day project .
lordan wrote the shadows ' hit apache among others .
the latest set of plaques will mark places or people who have made a significant contribution to music .
the shortlist also includes terry heath 's town house in wellington and has been submitted to a national panel , chaired by mike read who will issue new plaques in june .
author: Richard Tisdale
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tigers keep play-off hopes alive
text: telford tigers beat sheffield steeldogs 8-3 in the epl play-offs last night .
the impressive victory in sheffield means the tigers remain in contention for a place at the league 's finals tournament next month .
five goals in the opening 20 minutes took the game away from sheffield a day after tigers ' 7-0 thrashing of peterborough .
the epl champions now play guildford flames in surrey on wednesday .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: supersonic car studied in telford
text: a supersonic car is in shropshire this week hoping to inspire the designers and engineers of the future .
the bloodhound is hoping to smash through the 1,000mph barrier later this year and it 's spending this week at telford college of arts and technology .
there will be workshops and engineering challenges for students from the college and nearby schools as well as a visit from the project director on tuesday .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: campaign to improve breast feeding rates launched
text: three fifths of women who breastfeed their babies in telford and wrekin have given up after two months .
figures from public health england say the same is true for more than half of women in shropshire .
two months is just a third of the time recommended by experts .
the organisation 's start 4 life campaign says breastfeeding helps children fight infections early in life .
part of it is an interactive website designed to help new mums through their first weeks of breastfeeding .
author: Nigel Dolman
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : are the blue skies going to continue ?
text: a lovely day in store , with plenty of blue sky and sunshine around with highs of 14c ( 57f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: armed raider targets bank and shop
text: armed raider targets bank and shop

documents.title: shrewsbury town 0-2 bolton wanderers
text: shrewsbury town 0-2 bolton wanderers

documents.title: simulated beaver attacks work on aspens
text: simulated beaver attacks work on aspens
author: David Gregory-Kumar
Science, Environment & Rural Affairs Correspondent

documents.title: when first locomotive steamed down line
text: when first locomotive steamed down line

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening .

documents.title: shropshire muslim group speaks out against terrorism
text: the shropshire islamic foundation has spoken out against the terrorist attack in london earlier this week , calling it `` appalling and senseless '' .
it says it is also sent its `` deepest condolences to [ the murdered policeman 's ] family and the families of all those who lost their lives '' .
the group added that `` at times such as these that the community needs to come together to condemn violence and hatred '' .

documents.title: over 500 sign up for first whitchurch 10k
text: over 500 people have signed up to take part in the whitchurch 10k run next month .
it 's the first time the event has been held in the town and registration closes tomorrow .
the event takes place on 9 april is in aid of macmillan cancer support , which will get at least half the race profits .

documents.title: watch : weather for this evening and the weekend
text: it will be dry , clear and cold tonight with a touch of frost , particularly in rural areas .
we may see a few mist and fog patches forming by dawn in places .
lows of .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Weather

documents.title: vigil 'a chance for people to come together '
text: the organisers of the vigil in wellington tonight say it is `` an opportunity for people to come together and reflect on the awful atrocity that took place in london '' .
it 's been organised in response to the terror attack in westminster earlier this week .
andy brown from shropshire and telford stand up to racism said he also wanted people to `` stand against hatred and division in our community '' .
the vigil takes place at wellington peace garden , by the leisure centre , at 18:00 .

documents.title: bank taped off after armed robbery in shifnal
text: the police say they are talking to staff and passers-by after an armed robbery at the barclays bank in shifnal this afternoon .
eye-witnesses have reported seeing the building filled with smoke just after 15:30 and there were also fire engines called to the scene .
the building has now been taped off - police say no-one was hurt .

documents.title: breakingarmed robbery at shifnal bank
text: the police have just confirmed there was a report of an armed robbery at the barclays bank in shifnal this afternoon .
they say no-one was hurt .

documents.title: football : the new saints look to bounce back from rare defeat
text: tuesday 's defeat to connah 's quay was only the second in the league this season for the new saints , and they will be looking to bounce back against camarthen town tomorrow .
their opponents have n't won since 11 february and tns will be hoping to draw closer to the landmark of 100 league goals for the season .

documents.title: breakingemergency services called to barclays bank in shifnal
text: the police and fire service are at the barclays bank in shifnal , after smoke was seen inside the building .
west mercia police have n't yet said what is happening .

documents.title: to all you mums out there # getinspired
text: with mother 's day coming up on sunday , let ironman athlete jon alexander tell you the story of his mum , sue , and how she has always been his inspiration
you can find out how to get into triathlon with our get inspired guide .

documents.title: former bishop of lichfield , keith sutton , dies
text: a former bishop of lichfield , the right reverend keith sutton , has died aged 82 .
the news has been confirmed by the lichfield diocese - he served in the role from 1984 to 2003 .
before becoming bishop of lichfield he 'd been a special envoy for the archbishop of canterbury in south africa during the apartheid period in the 1980s .
the diocese says the former bishop , who had been living with dementia for several years , died today at a care home in surrey .
the diocese covers large parts of staffordshire , northern shropshire and the black country .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: only four ufo sightings investigated in last four years
text: only four reports of unidentified flying objects have been investigated by west mercia police since 2013 , the force has revealed .

they include a flaming object which landed in a tree near donnington in november 2013 , an object moving erratically in the sky over bridgnorth in september the following year - neither of these ufo sightings were explained .

there was also a report of a ufo not far from evesham in february last year , with `` lots of lights and a loud screaming sound '' , but this one turned out to be in gloucestershire , so it was passed on to their police force to investigate .
and only 12 months ago there were reports of `` strange lights '' over shrewsbury .
it turned out to be a helicopter .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers under pressure to win this weekend
text: telford tigers playoff defeat to guildford flames on wednesday means there can be no slip-ups against the peterborough phantoms tomorrow .
the tigers have to finish in the top two of their four-team group if they are going to make the finals in coventry next month .
although there are still five games to go , a second defeat would make qualification very difficult .
on sunday they travel to sheffield to take on the steeldogs .
peterborough are a very good team .
they 're well coached and have good netminding , so we have got to be prepared for anything .
every team will have tricks up their sleeve in these games , but i think it is all about intensity , hunger and desire to win . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: inspector rejects newport housing development plans
text: plans for 170 homes on the edge of newport have been turned down by a government planning inspector .
redrow homes wanted to demolish two houses in kestrel close and then build the proposed development on land east of kestrel close and beechfields way .
it had appealed to the inspector when it did n't get a decision from telford and wrekin council .

the council says the inspector concluded that the proposal would `` result in very serious adverse impacts on the character and appearance of the locally distinct landscape that would undergo irrevocable damage '' .
the inspector also ruled there were enough homes in the area , the authority said .
i am sure that residents in the area of kestrel close will be delighted with the planning inspector 's decision to refuse this speculative and inappropriate application . ''

documents.title: football : riley looks for long-term deal with shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury town full-back joe riley says he 's loving life at shrewsbury town and hopes to be kept on for next season .
he 's made 26 starts for the club and believes his form has improved since paul hurst became manager .
riley 's contract comes to an end in the summer and he says he `` feels at home '' in shrewsbury and hopes to be `` part of something '' at the club .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: alpaca show comes to telford
text: the british alpaca society 's national show is coming to the telford international centre this weekend .
this year 's show has over 600 entries , who will be judged by both british and international judges .

documents.title: cricket : boxing champion to pass on skills to cricketers
text: shropshire 's former champion boxer , richie woodhall , is hoping to pass on some skills to cricket coaches in the county .
he will be giving a talk to a coaches workshop at the shrewsbury club on 3 april and aims to show how some boxing stances and punching-types can relate to batting and fielding in cricket .
as well as holding wbc , olympic and commonwealth boxing titles , richie played cricket for madeley as a youngster .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new shropshire service station could create 70 jobs
text: up to 70 jobs could be created after fresh plans were lodged to build a service station complex on the outskirts of newport .
author: Newport Advertiser

documents.title: the fa people 's cup is back ! # peoplescup
text: it 's the semi-finals stage of the fa people 's cup this weekend and you 'll be able to keep up with all the action on our live text pages from 10:00-18:00 on saturday and sunday .
there 'll be loads more cracking goals like these ones , analysed by the football focus team after the first round .

documents.title: your photos : spring in the air around shropshire
text: spring has officially started and we 're really noticing that , in the photos being shared by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken near ludlow ( top ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: call to open second shrewsbury railway station entrance
text: a campaigner is calling for the reopening of a second entrance to shrewsbury railway station to help reduce traffic congestion in the town .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: in comic relief fundraising
text: comic relief fundraising events are taking place all around the county today and we 've been getting some great photos shared on the bbc radio shropshire facebook page .

documents.title: football : in-form bolton to visit shrewsbury
text: bolton wanderers are coming to shrewsbury tomorrow in a hot streak of form , having won their last four games , scoring 14 goals in the process .
they also boast league one 's meanest defence and are sitting in second place in the table .
a defeat for shrewsbury could see them return to the relegation zone .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : appeal to restore south shropshire woodland
text: natural england is attempting to raise £ 12,000 to buy about three acres of conifer plantation near the stiperstones in south shropshire .
it wants to bring back native broad-leaved trees to the area .

documents.title: cars caught doing nearly 100mph in 40mph zone
text: two cars were found hitting almost 100mph in a 40mph zone in a two-week period , new figures have revealed .
author: Market Drayton Advertiser

documents.title: vigil held in wellington tonight to call for unity after terror attacks
text: there 'll be a vigil at the peace garden outside wellington library from 18:00 tonight in the wake of the westminster attack .
organisers say they want to express their shock and distress at the killings and speak out for unity and against racism in the aftermath .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : former burton albion striker looking to impress at the bucks head
text: afc telford united have given former burton albion striker , dan westwood , a chance to revive his career at the bucks head .
he joined the brewers as a teenager , but had to drop down the leagues after struggling to make the grade - telford have signed him from the west midlands regional league side , wolves sporting .
the signs are hopeful though because he 's scored over a 100 goals in two seasons and telford had to beat at least three other clubs to get him .

documents.title: parents urged not to park on zig-zag lines outside schools
text: police in wellington are reminding people not to park on the zig-zag lines outside schools that are there to keep children safe .
parents dropping children off at school , do n't park on the zigzags , they are there to protect your children .
be considerate & sensible .
any reason why you 're raising awareness of this today in particular ?
nothing specific parking on school ( & crossing ) zig zags is an increasing problem though
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: wildlife supporter 'major hedgehog ' dies
text: wildlife supporter 'major hedgehog ' dies

documents.title: tributes paid to former council chairman and 'hedgehog friend '
text: tributes are being paid to a former chairman of shropshire county council who has died at the age of 86 .
major adrian coles was awarded an mbe for services to the community in 2000 , founded the british hedgehog preservation society , and finished his days as a chelsea pensioner .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: oswestry 's bt tower at the centre of the comic relief operation
text: oswestry will play a key role in taking donations for comic relief tonight , as part of red nose day .
the town 's bt network centre is running the operation .
staff at the firm 's call centre in shrewsbury will also be helping out .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: do n't forget the clocks go forward this weekend
text: the lighter nights are on the way .
get ready to say hello to british summer time on sunday .
weather tweets this simple reminder .
there 's always a bit of confusion around on social media about when it falls .
it 's almost ( british summer ) time !
do n't forget the # clocksgoforward on sunday .
lan
keep the dark nights !
! bst a pain ! !
noooooo !
i love the summer !
bst always
everyone except me i know have a lovely summer
british summer day light saving it is but spring
whens the cricket start , silly mid off and all those bouncers , chinamen , googlies , flighted deliveries , drives to the off side .
hurrah , summers on its way !
very early start for the australian grand prix
# bbc @ twitterid really bad people .
you pay for them and you do n't have a choice .
yay
@ twitterid # sundayshift
it 's a bit unfair that we only get five months worth of gmt .

documents.title: plans to make landlords more responsible in telford move forward
text: plans to tackle anti-social tenants in telford have taken a step forward .
last night the council agreed to a 10-week consultation about its attempts to make landlords take more responsibility for the homes they rent out on the area 's more run-down estates .
one councillor in an area affected by the proposed licensing scheme , paul watling , said residents were crying out for it .
however the leader of the minority conservative group , andrew eade ( is against the move .
it 's a hefty sum that landlords will have to pay , £ 600 over a five year period of course .
what we 'll end up with is good landlords are actually paying for the council to sort out bad landlords .
if landlords start to walk away and leave empty properties , that 's going to put those estates into an even greater spiral of decline . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: video : your 50-second weather forecast
text: after some early cloud it should be a bright day with plenty of sunshine and highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
do n't forget you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: good morning from today 's bbc shropshire live page
text: welcome to the bbc local live service for shropshire on friday morning .
i 'll be bringing you all the news , sport , travel and weather as it happens .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet us on @ twitterid or message via facebook .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: tractor death was an accident , inquest concludes
text: an inquest has concluded the death of a 65-year-old shropshire man , who was run over by a tractor , was an accident .

a jury heard douglas stead was driving the tractor and trailer at linley , near bishop 's castle last october , when it slipped and rolled on a steep rocky bank , causing him multiple injuries which resulted in his death .
no mechanical fault was found with the tractor .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: agreement to fund severn centre
text: the severn centre in highley will be jointly funded by shropshire council and highley parish council for the next 10 years .
the two councils have signed a joint agreement to keep it running until 2027 .
shropshire council has been working to find ways of reducing its spending by asking parish councils and community groups to take over the funding of some facilities .

documents.title: ww1 hero 's medals sell for £ 10,000
text: ww1 hero 's medals sell for £ 10,000

documents.title: former council chair adrian coles dies
text: prominent former shropshire county councillor major adrian coles has died aged 86 .
originally from knowbury , near ludlow , he hosted royal and ministerial visits to the county .
he also received an mbe for his services to the community in 2000 .
his family say he died of natural causes .

documents.title: video : your overnight weather forecast
text: some clear spells this evening , before cloud builds giving us overnight lows of 4c ( 39f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area on the bbc weather site .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: shrewsbury dana prison future still in limbo after refusal
text: the future of shrewsbury 's dana prison remains in limbo after shropshire council confirmed the building can be reopened as a prison or a centre for refugees .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: medal collection sells for £ 10k
text: a collection of medals that belonged to a welsh soldier in world war one have sold for £ 10,000 at a shrewsbury auction - less than the £ 12-18,000 they had been expected to raise .
the medals , which belonged to lt william morgan , included a rare albert medal , which he recieved in 1916 for saving his colleagues from a live grenade , which had fallen in their muddy trench .
lt morgan was also awarded the military cross in 1916 for leading a series of raids into enemy trenches .

documents.title: recorded child sex offences up by a third in west mercia area
text: the number recorded sex offences against children in the west mercia police area rose by a third last year , according to figures gathered by the nspcc .
a total of 1,569 were logged during 2015-16 across shropshire , herefordshire and worcestershire - an average of four a day .
out of that total , 434 were recorded against children aged 10 and under , while 72 of these crimes were perpetrated against victims aged four and under .

the nspcc says that while police record-keeping has improved and young people are more willing to report crimes now , it believes there will be many more cases going unreported and it is asking the government for more funding to help the victims .

documents.title: man arrested over high ercall robbery
text: police have arrested a 44-year-old man in connection with an armed robbery in high ercall .
postmaster stephen bentley told police that he was tied up and threatened while working at an outreach post office in the village hall last week .
police say the offenders stole £ 2,000 and his jaguar .

documents.title: tractor death inquest told there was no mechanical fault
text: an inquest has heard that a tractor slipped and rolled on a bank steeper than the burway , killing a man in october last year .
douglas stead , 65 , was spreading lime in fields off arbour lane in linley near bishop 's castle .
the tractor he was driving and its trailer turned over on rocky ground , but no mechanical fault was found with the tractor .
the inquest continues .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: royal marine sells his military cross
text: a royal marine from shropshire has sold his military cross at auction for £ 9,100 .
matthew bispham was awarded the medal in 2007 after fighting off taliban insurgents in defence of a dying colleague .
simon nuttall from wright marshall auctioneers who handled the sale said the medal had been awarded for `` great bravery '' and that few have been awarded during the reign of the current queen .

documents.title: gritting lorries on standby
text: it might be almost april , but we could see the gritting lorries out again tonight , with temperatures forecast to drop close to freezing overnight .

documents.title: football : telford extend loan of shrewsbury town goalkeeper
text: afc telford united have extended goalkeeper callum burton 's loan from shrewsbury town until the end of the season .
the youngster has already spent one month with the bucks , making his debut at salford in february .
the shrewsbury manager paul hurst is pleased to see burton getting more game time .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: high-tech university facilities officially opened
text: the university of wolverhampton has officially opened the £ 10m high-tech engineering facilities at its priorslee campus in telford .
they include flight and track simulators and opened to students last month .

documents.title: twelve-year jail terms for failed arsonists
text: four men are each starting 12-year jail sentences after an attempted arson attack
petrol was poured through the letter box at the home of a special constable in arleston , telford , in july 2015 , west mercia police said .
the attackers attempted to light it with a cigarette , which the officer managed to put out before the petrol caught fire , the force added .
two men from leegomery and two from birmingham were found guilty of conspiracy to commit arson with intent to endanger life , after a trial at stafford crown court :
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : a cloudy morning around shropshire
text: we 've been seeing plenty of cloud in the photos taken by the bbc weather watchers today .
these were taken near newport ( top ) and oswestry ( below ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: intruders damage excavator at treatment works
text: an excavator has been damaged at the oswestry water treatment works , after intruders got in on tuesday night and drove it around the site .
it ended up toppling on its side and the police say it caused `` a lot of damage '' .

documents.title: charges following telford drugs raids
text: three men and a woman have been charged after a series of drugs raids in telford on monday .
scott morgan , 34 , from burtondale , in brookside , and joel and louise boylett , .
aged 26 and 25 respectively , from cottom way , on the new lawley development are suspected of conspiracy to supply cocaine .
christopher jackson , a 31-year-old from crudgington , is accused of conspiracy to supply cannabis .
a 34-year-old from hadley and a 70-year-old man from arleston have been bailed for a month .

documents.title: plans to develop former railway station to go before councillors
text: plans to develop the former railway station at tern hill into a haulage yard go before shropshire councillors next week .
tony hamer and sons ltd , who supply sand and gravel , want to move to the site from their premises in market drayton .
supporters say it 'll provide jobs and investment , but some people who live nearby are worried about noise , dust and air pollution from the lorries .

documents.title: shrewsbury mp says work has to go on at parliament
text: the shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski was inside the houses of parliament when the terror attacks took place and said terrorists must n't be allowed to stop the work of the government .
mr kawczynski also said today would be `` very poignant '' with prayers being said in parliament for those who died and were seriously injured .
at one moment i felt guilty actually , at carrying on work .
but then i thought to myself , no , this is exactly what we have to do . ''

documents.title: horse racing : seven races at ludlow today
text: there are seven races at ludlow today .
local handler philip rowley is backing his horse our ben to go well in the abberley hall centenary hunters ' chase .
the first race gets under way at 14:30 .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: job prospects 'key ' to harper adams university success
text: harper adams university has claimed its spot at the top of the `` student experience '' league table , winning praise for its teaching , campus facilities and community atmosphere .
but , times higher education believes the key to its success may be its record of finding jobs for its graduates , saying students put `` enormous stock '' in their future career prospects .
96 % of graduates found jobs within six months .
the vice chancellor of harper adams , david llewellyn , said the university works very hard to provide extracurricular activities and create a sense of community among the students .
because we are based in the countryside our students ' union also puts on a very active social programme to help students get to know each other . ''

documents.title: cash boxes stolen from telford store
text: cash boxes have been stolen from the co-op store on wombridge road in trench .
the police say two men walked into the store on tuesday evening and one held open the door , while the other removed them from behind the tills .
the police have n't revealed how much money was taken , but say staff were n't threatened and that nobody was hurt .

documents.title: four charged after drugs raids in telford
text: four people have been charged after a series of dawn raids across telford .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: telford park school out of special measures
text: telford park school has been taken out of special measures .
the academy , which used to be lord silkin school , was one of several in the borough which were declared inadequate by inspectors .
a new report says the school still `` requires improvement '' , but it 's being well-led and results are getting better .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers ' winning run ends with play-off defeat
text: telford tigers ' 16-game winning run came to an abrupt end in their first play-off match last night - beaten 3-0 by guildford flames .
the english premier league champions now have to bounce back in their matches against peterborough and sheffield if they are going to make the finals in coventry .
telford had beaten the same opponents 4-2 just a fortnight ago .
i thought we started slow and trying to play from behind is always frustrating .
i do n't think guildford came here and did anything we have n't seen all season .
we struggled to break it down and they did a great job of getting in the way , and making it hard to get pucks through .
their netminder did n't really have any quality saves to make . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: flags fly at half-mast at council buildings
text: both telford and wrekin and shropshire councils are flying flags at half mast today as a mark of respect to those affected by yesterday 's terrorist attack in london .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: brexit , elections , revolts . and labour ?
text: brexit , elections , revolts . and labour ?
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: reports of child sex offences 'double '
text: the number of child sex offences recorded in the west midlands has doubled , according to the national society for prevention of cruelty to children .
between 2014 and 2015 there were 1,265 cases .
last year , that number rose to more than 2,500 .
the charity says a number of factors could have led to the rise , including :
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: mps display 'steely resolve '
text: shrewsbury and atcham mp daniel kawczynski said there was an air of defiance as parliament prepared to meet today .

mr kawczynski was trapped in the palace of westminster alongside hundreds of politicians , staff and journalists while police dealt with yesterday 's terrorist attack which claimed four lives and left 40 injured .
quiet but steely resolve today in parliament from everyone , we will never bend to terrorism of any kind .
indeed
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fire service warns about skin creams
text: your skin cream could be a fire hazard !
shropshire fire and rescue service says that 37 people in britain have died in the last six years in fires caused by skin creams , used to treat conditions such as eczema and psoriasis .
the paraffin-based creams soak into bed clothes and sheets making them flammable .
no incidents have been reported in shropshire , but the fire service here says you should wash your sheets regularly at high temperatures .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: harper adams university top in student experience poll
text: harper adams university near newport has been voted the best in the uk in terms of student experience .
fifteen thousand students were surveyed by times higher education .
the university was rated second behind loughborough in 2015 but beat all 120 other institutions again this time .
it won praise for its teaching , campus facilities and community atmosphere .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: leutwiler wins second cap as canada frustrate scotland
text: shrewsbury town 's jayson leutwiler won his second cap for canada last night .
the goalkeeper came on at half time with the score 1-1 and kept scotland out as canada drew in front of fewer than 10,000 fans edinburgh .
he 'll be back on duty with shrewsbury in time for saturday 's game against bolton .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: video : is it going to rain all day ?
text: after a damp and cloudy start , any showers should clear with bright and sunny spells developing this afternoon and highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
you can find a detailed forecast for your area here .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: mps return to work after terror attack
text: shropshire 's mps are returning to work in london , following yesterday 's terrorist attack at the palace of westminster .
four people died and 40 were injured by what police think was a lone attacker yesterday afternoon .
shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski , telford 's lucy allan and ludlow mp philip dunne were inside while parliament entered a state of lockdown .
the mp for the wrekin mark pritchard was in dublin , but he 's back in london and remains defiant .
thoughts and prayers are with those that have been injured and killed , and i hope it just reminds us of the excellent job police do every single day of the week both in west mercia and in the met .
it also reminds us of the threat level .
we have a lot of people who want to destroy our values . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: welcome to bbc local live in shropshire
text: good morning .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to bring you the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet .
or comment on our facebook .
page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .
you can also follow minute-by-minute updates on the .
westminster attack on bbc news .

documents.title: community centre to be handed over to local group next month
text: the sutton hill community centre will be handed over to a local charity on 24 april .
the sutton hill community trust says it is looking to recruit volunteers to help out in the cafe and to run events and a youth club .
the community centre is one of several being off-loaded by telford and wrekin council in an attempt to cut costs .
we are really looking forward to taking over the community centre for the people of sutton hill .
it 's our centre and we want it to be somewhere all local people want to come to , to get involved in activities , classes , events or just to pop in for a chat and a cuppa . ''

documents.title: your comments : mixed views on hospital smoking ban
text: the news that there is going to be a complete smoking ban at the hospitals in shrewsbury and telford has been provoking some comment on the bbc radio shropshire facebook page .
darran dorsett said it might take some time for people to accept the change , but was in favour , writing : `` i 'm surprised it has taken so long for them to be made smoke-free .
i remember the main entrance having dog-ends all around - not the nicest of sights when you visit . ''
but haze farrelly thought the total ban was a bad idea .
she wrote : `` the thing is , a lot of people could be going through hell with relatives or something .
cigarettes are bad , we know , but also horrendously addictive and therefore a dedicated area for smokers should be given . ''
chris morris questioned the ban 's effectiveness , adding : '' try enforcing it , great idea ?
we will see ! ! ''

documents.title: overnight forecast : a chilly night ahead
text: the rain and showers will ease overnight to leave most places dry .
it will be a chilly night with patchy frost and fog possible .
further rain will be arriving from the east during the early hours of the morning - lows of -1c ( 30f ) .
tomorrow , any wind and rain will die out through the afternoon , becoming brighter and drier .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: 50 homeless people taken off telford streets by charity
text: a charity is celebrating a successful 12 months after helping take over 50 homeless people off the streets .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: your comments : merger of shropshire councils
text: we 've been asking if people would welcome a merger of shropshire council and telford and wrekin council , following comments made by the north shropshire mp , owen paterson .

he claimed it could save £ 20m a year , and alan westlake gave us his thoughts on our facebook page , claiming there was inefficiency at the moment and writing : `` a joint shake up may not be a bad thing .
time for a change ? ''

but david hurdley disagreed , writing : `` we voted for unitary authority in 1998 and that is called democracy , so what paterson is calling for is against the democratic rights of the people of telford & wrekin . ''
and rosemary perry from telford added : `` no no no .
we have our own authority . ''

documents.title: wrekin mp sends message of defiance to terrorists
text: ironically , the wrekin mp , mark pritchard , has been in dublin today , to discuss counter-terrorism .
he said the attack at westminster this afternoon should remind us of the threat level to the uk and paid tribute to the work of the security services - he said parliament would n't be intimidated .
mr pritchard also said he has been able to track down the majority of his staff in parliament , to make sure they are safe .

terrorism will not win and we will continue to sit at the parliament once the area has been secured and we will make a stand in our democratic way - our values will not be trampled on by these people that seek to undermine our way of life . ''

documents.title: rare war medal awarded for grenade incident
text: while the military cross might be the best-known medal from the collection going on sale in shrewsbury today , lt col william morgan 's albert medal ( second from the left ) is perhaps the most valued by collectors .
fewer than 600 have ever been issued .
the story behind its award , according to the london gazette , was that he had been training soldiers how to use grenades in a trench , when someone accidentally dropped a live grenade in the mud .
it sank so deep , only the smoke from the fuse could be seen , but he was able to dig it out and throw it over the parapet , saving the class from death or serious injury .
he was presented with the medal by king george v at buckingham palace in december 1916 .

documents.title: telford council leader praises security services
text: the leader of telford and wrekin council , shaun davies , has been commenting on events in westminster this afternoon .
he said his thoughts were with all of the local mps and their staff .
makes you even more thankful for police , security staff , nhs and other public services

documents.title: ludlow mp describes scenes inside parliament
text: the mp for ludlow , philip dunne , said he was heading down escalators to go to vote in parliament when he heard shouting .
he saw people running back along the cloister saying there had been shots and another saying there had been a stabbing .
he said it was all very confusing , but the police were very quick to evacuate and his department of health meeting has now resumed .

documents.title: shropshire mps react to attack in westminster
text: shropshire 's mps have been reacting to the attack outside the houses of parliament this afternoon .
commons leader , david lidington , has told mps a man was shot by armed police following a `` serious '' incident - staff inside parliament were told to stay inside their offices .
the mp for the wrekin , mark pritchard , is in dublin for meetings with police but he 's said `` terrorism will not win '' .
the mp for telford , lucy allan , was at parliament for prime ministers ' questions and a researcher for the shrewsbury mp , daniel kawczynski , has said they have been asked to move downstairs .
